t: Jeremiah 4
“If*pn you will return, O Israel,” says the Lord,*s “Return*ld to Me; And*ld if you will put away your abominations out of My sight, Then*ld you shall not be moved.
And*ld you shall swear, ‘The Lord*s lives,’ In*ld truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; The*ld nations shall bless themselves in Him, And*ld in Him they shall glory.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the men of Judah and Jerusalem: “Break*pn up your fallow ground, And*ld do not sow among thorns.

Circumcise*ld yourselves to the Lord,*s And*ld take away the foreskins of your hearts, You*ld men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem, Lest*ld My fury come forth like fire, And*ld burn so that no one can quench it,*i Because*ld of the evil of your doings.”
An Imminent Invasion
Declare*p in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say: “Blow*pn the trumpet in the land; Cry,*ld ‘Gather together,’ And*ld say, ‘Assemble yourselves, And*ld let us go into the fortified cities.’
Set*ld up the standard toward Zion. Take*ld refuge! Do not delay! For*ld I will bring disaster from the north, And*ld great destruction.”

The*ld lion has come up from his thicket, And*ld the destroyer of nations is on his way. He*ld has gone forth from his place To*ld make your land desolate. Your*ld cities will be laid waste, Without*ld inhabitant.
For*ld this, clothe yourself with sackcloth, Lament*ld and wail. For*ld the fierce anger of the Lord*s Has*ld not turned back from us.

“And*ln it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord,*s “That*ild the heart of the king shall perish, And*ld the heart of the princes; The*ld priests shall be astonished, And*ld the prophets shall wonder.”
Then*ln I said, “Ah, Lord God!*s Surely*ld You have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, Saying,*ld ‘You shall have peace,’ Whereas*ld the sword reaches to the heart.”
At*ln that time it will be said To*ld this people and to Jerusalem, “A*ld dry wind of the desolate heights blows*i in the wilderness Toward*ld the daughter of My people— Not*ld to fan or to cleanse—
A*ld wind too strong for these will come for Me; Now*ld I will also speak judgment against them.”
“Behold,*ln he shall come up like clouds, And*ld his chariots like a whirlwind. His*ld horses are swifter than eagles. Woe*ld to us, for we are plundered!”
O*ln Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, That*ld you may be saved. How*ld long shall your evil thoughts lodge within you?
For*ld a voice declares from Dan And*ld proclaims affliction from Mount Ephraim:
“Make*ld mention to the nations, Yes,*ld proclaim against Jerusalem, That*ild watchers come from a far country And*ld raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
Like*ld keepers of a field they are against her all around, Because*ld she has been rebellious against Me,” says the Lord.*s
“Your*ld ways and your doings Have*ld procured these things*i for you. This*ld is*i your wickedness, Because*ld it is bitter, Because*ld it reaches to your heart.”
Sorrow for the Doomed Nation

O*pn my soul, my soul! I*ld am pained in my very heart! My*ld heart makes a noise in me; I*ld cannot hold my peace, Because*ld you have heard, O my soul, The*ld sound of the trumpet, The*ld alarm of war.
Destruction*ld upon destruction is cried, For*ld the whole land is plundered. Suddenly*ld my tents are plundered, And*ild my curtains in a moment.
How*ld long will I see the standard, And*ild hear the sound of the trumpet?
“For*ln My people are*i foolish, They*ld have not known Me. They*ld are*i silly children, And*ld they have no understanding. They*ld are*i wise to do evil, But*ld to do good they have no knowledge.”
I*ln beheld the earth, and indeed it*i was*i without form, and void; And*ld the heavens, they had*i no light.
I*ld beheld the mountains, and indeed they trembled, And*ld all the hills moved back and forth.
I*ld beheld, and indeed there*i was*i no man, And*ld all the birds of the heavens had fled.
I*ld beheld, and indeed the fruitful land was*i a wilderness, And*ld all its cities were broken down At*ld the presence of the Lord,*s By*ld His fierce anger.
For*p thus says the Lord:*s “The*pn whole land shall be desolate; Yet*ld I will not make a full end.
For*ld this shall the earth mourn, And*ld the heavens above be black, Because*ld I have spoken. I*ld have purposed and will not relent, Nor*ld will I turn back from it.

The*ld whole city shall flee from the noise of the horsemen and bowmen. They*ld shall go into thickets and climb up on the rocks. Every*ld city shall*i be*i forsaken, And*ld not a man shall dwell in it.

“And*ln when*i you are*i plundered, What*ld will you do? Though*ld you clothe yourself with crimson, Though*ld you adorn yourself*i with ornaments of gold, Though*ld you enlarge your eyes with paint, In*ld vain you will make yourself fair; Your*ild lovers will despise you; They*ld will seek your life.

“For*ln I have heard a voice as of a woman in labor, The*ld anguish as of her who brings forth her first child, The*ld voice of the daughter of Zion bewailing herself; She*ld spreads her hands, saying,*i ‘Woe*ld is*i me now, for my soul is weary Because*ld of murderers!’
